data.name: MountPathInfo
data.value: The mount path can either be a file or a drive. If you're using the GOG version it'll be the 'game.inst' file. If you have a disc image it is usually the .cue file. Otherwise use the drive letter of the game disc.

data.name: MountOption_FileInfo
data.value: Indicate that the mount path is a file

data.name: MountOption_DriveInfo
data.value: Indicate that the mount path is a drive or disc

data.name: DosBoxSettingsInfo
data.value: Setting one of the below options to disabled or empty will use the default value specified in the DOSBox configuration file. If a specific configuration file has been specified in the settings it may overwrite some of the settings below.

data.name: DosBoxOptions_AspectCorrectionInfo
data.value: Do aspect correction, if your output method doesn't support scaling this can slow things down!

data.name: DosBoxOptions_MemorySizeInfo
data.value: Amount of memory DOSBox has in megabytes

data.name: DosBoxOptions_FrameskipInfo
data.value: How many frames DOSBox skips before drawing one

data.name: DosBoxOptions_FullscreenResInfo
data.value: What resolution to use for fullscreen: original, desktop or fixed size (e.g. 1024x768)

data.name: DosBoxOptions_WindowedResInfo
data.value: Scale the window to this size IF the output device supports hardware scaling

data.name: DosBoxOptions_ScalerInfo
data.value: Scaler used to enlarge/enhance low resolution modes

data.name: DosBoxOptions_CoreInfo
data.value: CPU Core used in emulation. Auto switches from normal to dynamic if appropriate.

data.name: DosBoxOptions_CyclesInfo
data.value: Amount of instructions DOSBox tries to emulate each millisecond. Setting this value too high results in sound dropouts and lags. You can also let DOSBox guess the correct value by setting it to max. The default setting (auto) switches to max if appropriate.

data.name: Config_FullscreenInfo
data.value: Makes the game run in fullscreen, otherwise it'll run in windowed mode

data.name: Config_TnLInfo
data.value: Uncheck this if there are graphical glitches in the game

data.name: Config_ControllerInfo
data.value: If your controller is not recognized you can enable controller support here

data.name: Config_ResolutionR2Info
data.value: If the widescreen support is not enabled the game will stretch if set to an aspect ratio other than 4:3

data.name: Config_WidescreenSupportInfo
data.value: Widescreen support ensures that the game is not stretched when running in an aspect ratio other than 4:3

data.name: Config_LanguageR2Info
data.value: This sets the default language selected when launching the game. The language can still be changed from the game menu.

data.name: Config_ControllerR2Info
data.value: If your controller is not recognized you can enable controller support here. This will remove any custom button mapping.

data.name: Config_ButtonMappingInfo
data.value: As the game doesn't allow native button remapping you change it here. This will not work for controllers.

data.name: Config_RRRScreenModeInfo
data.value: The screen mode options will behave differently depending on the selected resolution. Usually keeping the 4:3 mode enabled will allow the game not to be stretched on different aspect ratios.

data.name: About_ProgramInfo
data.value: Rayman Control Panel is an open source community project created by RayCarrot. This software is a single free to use executable file with the intent to easily access settings and fixes for the various Rayman titles released for Windows. This is a growing project with more features planned on being added with future updates. The utilities and various configuration tools have been created with help from various members of the Rayman community, all credited below.

data.name: Settings_UserLevelInfo
data.value: The user level determines which options and information is available in the application. The higher the user level, the more advanced options and information will be shown.

data.name: Settings_UserLevelNormalInfo
data.value: Normal user level - for users who want all the default features without any of the more advanced options or technical details

data.name: Settings_UserLevelAdvancedInfo
data.value: Advanced user level - for users who want more advanced features above the default ones, but without the technical details

data.name: Settings_UserLevelTechnicalInfo
data.value: Technical user level - for users who want more advanced features above the default ones as well as the technical details

data.name: Settings_UserLevelDebugInfo
data.value: Debug user level - for app developers and testers who want advanced debug options and information

data.name: Settings_DesignSuccessMessagesInfo
data.value: Show a message when an operation has succeeded

data.name: Settings_DesignShowTaskBarProgress
data.value: Show progress on task bar icon

data.name: Settings_DesignShowTaskBarProgressInfo
data.value: Show download progress on the taskbar icon

data.name: Settings_GeneralCloseOnLaunch
data.value: Close application when launching a game

data.name: R1U_TPLSInfo
data.value: By default the PC version only has a single music track for each world. This patch makes each level have its own track, similarily to on PlayStation.

data.name: R1U_CompleteOSTInfo
data.value: Rayman Forever, including the GOG version, does not come with the complete soundtrack due to disc space originally not being available. This utility can replace the existing incomplete soundtrack with the complete one, or alternatively revert it back.

data.name: R3U_DirectPlayInfo
data.value: DirectPlay needs to be enabled in order to run Rayman 3. By default it is usually disabled on Windows 10.

data.name: RDU_ReplaceFilesInfo
data.value: Some versions of Rayman Designer, including Rayman Forever, have some of the RayKit files infected with a malware. Although it does not appear to be harmful, or even active, and GOG has confirmed there is no danger, you can still safely replace the files with their non-infected versions using this utility.

data.name: RDU_CreateConfigInfo
data.value: During some Rayman Designer installations the configuration file won't be created, causing the Mapper to give an error when launching. This utility will fix that issue by creating the configuration file if not present.

data.name: RLU_UbiRayInfo
data.value: This utility modifies the game configuration to make UbiRay appear as a normal costume in the Heroes Gallery

data.name: ROU_DebugCommandsInfo
data.value: Using any of the below debug commands allows the game to be launched in a debug environment, with the commands changing how the game runs.

data.name: ROU_DebugCommandsWarning
data.value: WARNING: Using these debug commands may corrupt your save file. Always make a backup before using them.

data.name: ROU_DebugCommandsInvincibilityInfo
data.value: This allows the player to not die when taking damage

data.name: ROU_DebugCommandsHideMouseInfo
data.value: This will hide the mouse pointer in the game menus

data.name: ROU_DebugCommandsMaxZoomInfo
data.value: This will max out the camera zoom

data.name: ROU_DebugCommandsFramerateInfo
data.value: This will set the framerate to run the game in

data.name: ROU_DebugCommandsMapInfo
data.value: This will allow a specific map to be loaded instead of the main menu upon starting the game

data.name: ROU_DebugCommandsLanguageInfo
data.value: This will change the language the game runs in

data.name: ROU_UpdateInfo
data.value: In case Rayman Origins has not been automatically updated to its latest version, 1.02, this utility can update it.

data.name: FirstLaunchInfo_Title
data.value: Welcome to the Rayman Control Panel

data.name: FirstLaunchInfo_Header
data.value: Welcome to the Rayman Control Panel

data.name: FirstLaunchInfo_Text
data.value: This program is an unofficial open source community project created by RayCarrot. It allows quick and easy access to all installed PC Rayman games on your computer, with additional features such as extended configuration support, utilities, save file backups, save data management, texture modifications and more. Supported games can be installed directly from their disc through the program. To get started, change the settings you want below and press 'Continue'. The settings can be changed at any time in the settings page.

data.name: GameOptions_UnsavedChanges
data.value: Your configuration changes have not been saved. Do you want to exit and discard them?

data.name: DowngradeWarning
data.value: You are using an older version of the program ({0}) compared to the version of the current app data ({1}). This is not recommended and may cause compatibility issues. These may be fixed by resetting the app data for this program.

data.name: About_Credits_Snagglebee
data.value: Per-level soundtrack utility, Rayman M/Arena disc check removal

data.name: PostUpdate_MigrateFiestaRunBackup5Error

data.name: Settings_ArchiveGFGenerateMipmapsInfo
data.value: Automatically generate mipmaps for supported games when importing to .gf files

data.name: Settings_ArchiveGFTransparency_PreserveFormatInfo
data.value: The original format will always be preserved. Importing an ARGB image to a .gf file which doesn't support transparency will result in the alpha channel getting lost.

data.name: Settings_ArchiveGFTransparency_UpdateBasedOnPixelFormatInfo
data.value: The format will be updated to match that of the imported file. This might result in the .gf files taking more space than actually required.

data.name: Settings_ArchiveGFTransparency_UpdateBasedOnPixelFormatIfUtilizedInfo
data.value: The format will be updated to match that of the imported file if the current format doesn't support the data. For example if an ARGB image is being imported to a .gf file which doesn't support transparency it will only update the format to support it if the imported image utilizes the alpha channel. This setting is recommended to avoid changing formats when not necessary, however it will slow down the file importing.

data.name: Download_ManualInstructions
data.value:
Download files:
1. Press the download button to manually download the files. 2. Move the files to the destination directory. If they're compressed, extract them. 3. Press 'Ok' to continue.

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemoryModsInfo
data.value: Enable removed prototype features in the game by selecting the mods you want and then apply them. This requires the game to be running and only works with the GOG and Steam versions. Applied mods will only be in effect when the game is running and will be reset when closed.

data.name: Mod_RRR_BFModsInfo
data.value: Modified .bf files. These will only be used when running the game from the option below.

data.name: Mod_RRR_ApplyExePatchInfo
data.value: The executable patch is required for patched BF files due to a memory limit

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_EnableProtoFeaturesInfo
data.value: Rayman's prototype behavior is enabled in all levels

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_AddCamControlsInfo
data.value: Camera controls are mapped to the right stick

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_AddDuelInfo
data.value: "Bunnies are shooting all over the place" replaces "Bunnies don't milk cows part 2". Play it in multiplayer!

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_AddPlaytestMenuInfo
data.value: Not recommended. The playtest menu replaces the game type selection, but you cannot pause or exit loaded levels.

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_RaymanInfo
data.value: For an Xbox 360 controller, the controls are mapped as follows: A: Jump / Hold in the air to use helicopter X: Attack Y: Use grappling hook LB: Toggle light / Hold to control dance tempo if enabled LT: Look mode if enabled RB: Attack / Press or hold to use finishers if enabled RT: Dodge roll / Ground pound / Roll and jump multiple times to boost if enabled D-Pad Up: Toggle dance mode. In dance mode, press ABXY or use the left analog stick to perform dance moves Left analog stick: Move Rayman Right analog stick: Camera controls if enabled Back: Noclip mode Start: Pause

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_AddLookModeInfo
data.value: A first-person look mode is added and mapped to LT

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_AddBoostButtonInfo
data.value: Normally reserved to an item not present in the game, pressing RT will make Rayman run really fast and enable speed attacks

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_AddFinishersInfo
data.value: Hold or press RB to add finishers into your combos

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_ClimbWallsInfo
data.value: Allows Rayman to grab hold of any wall by using his hook

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_HangFromSpotsInfo
data.value: Breaks hook behavior but enables a broken system for using the hook as a rope to hang and jump from

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_GrappinGFXInfo
data.value: Enables even earlier looks for Rayman's hook

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_UpgradedPowersInfo
data.value: Allows Rayman to use the helicopter for a longer time and, if Climb walls is enabled, hold onto walls infinitely

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_ImmortalInfo
data.value: A developer cheat - Rayman does not die

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_ControlTempoInfo
data.value: In dance mode, holding LB will start a beat for Rayman to dance to

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_SetCostumeInfo
data.value: Rayman's costume will always be based on the player's costume selection in the menu

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_DisableIntrosInfo
data.value: Minigame intro cinematics change the state of the world and sometimes deactivate Rayman (e.g. Bunnies don't give gifts)

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_DisableFootstepSoundInfo
data.value: If BF mods aren't activated, Rayman's footstep sound in most areas can be annoying - use this option to turn it off

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_LessSlipperyInfo
data.value: Rayman feels slippery by default, this slightly improves that

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_DrawHealthManaInfo
data.value: Whenever Rayman performs a special attack or gets hit, his HP and Mana will be displayed

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_RabbidsDropItemsInfo
data.value: Rabbids drop their items for Rayman to use

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_RandomProtoRabbidPowersInfo
data.value: Some Rabbids are given one of 4 prototype powers. Discover them while playing!

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_TameMountsInfo
data.value: Mounts become controllable when you first ride them

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_BatsActLikeEaglesInfo
data.value: Bats become huge and act like the eagle with different animations

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_PigsActLikePlumsInfo
data.value: Pigs use plum behavior and become very bouncy. Try throwing them onto the rabbids' heads!

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_AggressiveRhinosInfo
data.value: The rhinos from the races will attack you. Be prepared to die (or use the immortal cheat)!

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_SpiderJumpInfo
data.value: When riding the spider-like robots, you can jump like spiders could in the prototype

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_BatShootInfo
data.value: Bats can shoot projectiles with the attack button

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_SaucersStartFlyingInfo
data.value: Saucers can be found flying around, but this makes them harder to mount

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_MissileLaunchersTargetInfo
data.value: Missiles will target Rayman, but 1 hit from them will kill Rayman!

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_DontDestroyBipodsInfo
data.value: Most bipods collapse by default when not in FPS mode. This prevents them from being destroyed.

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_ActivatorTriggersInfo
data.value: Forces all activator triggers to be true constantly. Causes chaos in many levels and spawns many more enemies (and Globox babies)

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_BoundingVolumeTriggersInfo
data.value: Some rabbid spawn triggers are difficult to reach. This triggers them, but beware, it also causes crashes in many levels!

data.name: Mod_RRR_BFPatch_SpiderRobotSoundLikeSpider
data.value: Make spider robot sound like spider

data.name: Mod_RRR_BFPatch_FlashlightMines
data.value: Add flashlight to Bunnies Love Digging Tunnels

data.name: Mod_RRR_BFPatch_RabbidItems
data.value: Add unused rabbid items to Bunnies Aren't Scared Of The Dark

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_ApplyError
data.value: The memory patch could not be applied

data.name: Mod_RRR_BFPatch_InvalidGameDir
data.value: The game install directory is invalid

data.name: Mod_RRR_BFPatch_UnsupportedGameExe
data.value: The game version is not supported

data.name: Mod_RRR_BFPatch_RevertExePatchSuccess
data.value: The executable patch was successfully reverted

data.name: Mod_RRR_BFPatch_ApplyExePatchError
data.value: An error occurred when patching the executable

data.name: Mod_RRR_BFPatch_RemovePatchedBFSuccess
data.value: The patched BF file has been removed

data.name: Mod_RRR_BFPatch_RemovePatchedBFError
data.value: Unable to remove patched BF file

data.name: Mod_RRR_BFPatch_UpdatePatchedBFSuccess
data.value: The patched BF file was successfully updated

data.name: Mod_RRR_BFPatch_UpdatePatchedBFError
data.value: An error occurred when updating the patched BF file

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_NoInstaKillInfo
data.value: Instead of instantly dying Rayman will now die after 4 hits

data.name: Mod_RRR_MemMod_UnlockAllMinigamesInfo
data.value: A developer cheat. Everything in score mode and the bonus section is unlocked regardless of your progress in the game.

data.name: ConfirmResetData
data.value: Are you sure you want to reset the app settings? This can not be undone.

data.name: InvalidResolution
data.value: Invalid resolution. Must be in the format of 'Width x Height'.

data.name: DriveSelection_RefreshError
data.value: An error occurred when finding available drives

data.name: Settings_UseChildWindowsInfo
data.value: Enabling this will show windows, such as the game options window or message dialogs, as popups within in the main window. Disabling this will show them as separate windows.

data.name: Archive_ReplaceFile_Error
data.value: An error occurred when replacing the file

data.name: Config_RRROldMovie
data.comment: This is the name of the cheat which places a filter on the game

data.name: Config_OutdatedPatchNotice
data.value: The applied patch is outdated. Keep the patch enabled and save to update it to the newest version.

data.name: Progression_SaveEditWarning
data.value: Editing save files may corrupt them if done incorrectly. It is highly recommended to keep a backup before proceeding. Continue?

data.name: Progression_SaveEditSuccess
data.value: The save file has been successfully modified

data.name: Progression_BackupStatus_Outdated
data.value: New changes are not backed up

data.name: Progression_DataSourceInfo
data.value: For older applications Windows will in some cases redirect save/config files to the VirtualStore if the application is not running as admin. The side effect of this is that you will have different save/config files being used for the game depending on if you're running it as admin or not. By changing the data source here you can choose which location is used for backups and the progression view.

data.name: Progression_DataSource_AutoInfo
data.value: When creating a new backup or using the save files for the progression view then the location with the most recent files is chosen. When restoring a backup it will restore to both locations.

data.name: Progression_DataSource_DefaultInfo
data.value: The default location is always used. This corresponds to the location the game uses when it is running as admin.

data.name: Progression_DataSource_VirtualStoreInfo
data.value: The VirtualStore location is always used. This corresponds to the location the game uses when it is not running as admin.

data.name: Settings_SerializationLogInfo
data.value: Enabling the log will have any binary serialization action, such as using the Archive Explorer or viewing game progression, log to the specified log file. This is primarily for debugging, but can also be useful for viewing the data structure of certain formats.

data.name: Utilities_Converter_SelectConvertBackFormat
data.value: Select format to convert back to

data.name: Utilities_Format_UnityPlayerPrefsHeader
data.value: Unity Player Preferences / Rabbids Big Bang Save File (.dat)

data.name: Utilities_Format_GameMakerDSMapHeader
data.value: Game Maker DS Map / Rayman Redemption Save File (.txt)

data.name: Utilities_Serializers_LogError
data.value: The files could not be logged

data.name: Utilities_Serializers_DeserializeError
data.value: The files could not be deserialized

data.name: Utilities_Serializers_SerializeError
data.value: The files could not be serialized

data.name: Config_RRRCheatsInfo
data.value: The cheats will go into effect when first loading a map. Sometimes it is also required to return to the menu afterwards for everything to update.

data.name: R3U_DirectPlayNotAvailable
data.value: DirectPlay can only be toggled on Windows 8 or above

data.name: RFRU_SaveFixInfo
data.value: Due to a bug in earlier versions of the game the save file progress might get out of sync causing you to have fewer teensies than actually earned. This can cause certain levels to become inaccessible. This utility will attempt to correct this.

data.name: RFRU_SaveFixError
data.value: An error occurred when fixing the save

data.name: ROU_DebugCommandsNotAvailable
data.value: Debug commands are not available for the Steam version

data.name: About_Credits_XanderNT
data.value: Hebrew program translation, game patch file icon

data.name: Settings_ArchiveCNTSyncOnRepackInfo
data.value: If enabled the textures for the game will be automatically synchronized when a .cnt archive is repacked. This is useful for games where synchronizing is required to import higher resolution textures.

data.name: Archive_AddFiles_ConflictMultiple
Mod_Mem_ProcessInfo
data.value: By attaching to a running game process you will be able to modify and view game values in real-time. For certain games this will allow you to enable unused features.

data.name: Mod_Mem_AttachError
data.value: An error occurred when attaching to the process

data.name: Mod_Mem_TickError
data.value: An error occurred when updating the game values

data.name: Mod_Mem_R1_PlaceRayInfo
data.value: Allows Rayman to be placed freely in the level

data.name: Mod_Mem_R1_MapSelectInfo
data.value: Toggles the in-game map selection on the world map

data.name: Mod_Mem_R1_DemoModeInfo
data.value: If enabled then the game will start playing the unused two recorded demos when the level loads. This can be triggered by losing all lives and choosing to try again.

data.name: Mod_Mem_R1_MultiplayerMenusInfo
data.value: When this is enabled the game will load the unused multiplayer menus on startup. If the game has already been started then this can be accessed by choosing to quit the game from the pause menu. The multiplayer menus themselves are not complete due to this feature never being fully implemented. The first menu is the player selection and the second one the level selection. Due to these not being functional the only way to change these are by using the below fields.

data.name: R2_LevelName_batam_10
data.value: Meanwhile in the Prison Ship Part 1

data.name: R2_LevelName_batam_20
data.value: Meanwhile in the Prison Ship Part 2

data.name: R2_LevelName_water
data.value: The Sanctuary of Water and Ice

data.name: R2_LevelName_plum
data.value: The Sanctuary of Stone and Fire

data.name: R2_LevelName_earth
data.value: The Sanctuary of Rock and Lava

data.name: R2_LevelName_helic
data.value: Beneath the Sanctuary of Rock and Lava

data.name: UnsavedChangesQuestion
data.value: There are unsaved changes. Do you want to continue and discard them?

data.name: Archive_AutoSyncCPATextures
data.value: Do you want to automatically synchronize the game textures when a texture archive is repacked? Synchronizing is required for higher resolution textures to work in some levels. This can be changed at any time in the settings page.

data.name: ModLoader_ExtractPatch
data.comment: Extracting will extract the contents within the patch

data.name: AppData_MigrateError
data.value: An error occurred when migrating the app data to the new version

data.name: Games_RemovedInvalidGames
data.value:
The following games are no longer valid and were removed:
{0}

data.name: GameClients_RemovedInvalidClients
data.value:
The following game clients/emulators are no longer valid and were removed:
{0}

data.name: GameAdd_LocateFileInvalidFile
data.value:
The selected file is not valid for this game
{0}

data.name: Utilities_SyncTextureInfo_Info
data.value: Synchronize textures. This updates the texture sizes in the game files to match the texture files. This is required to do if the resolution of a texture has been increased or else the game might crash.

data.name: GameClients_Launch_ClientNotFound
data.value: The game client/emulator could not be found

data.name: GameClients_Custom_LaunchArgsInfo
data.value: Here you can specify which launch arguments are passed in to the program. For the game path, type %game%. It is recommended to surround it with quotes to avoid the path being cut off on spaces.

data.name: Page_LoadError
data.value: An error occurred when loading the page

data.name: GameClients_SelectionInfo
data.value: Here a client or emulator can be selected to be used with the game. The selected client will be responsible for launching the game. For emulated games this is required as they can't launch on their own.

data.name: RR2Options_GameModeInfo
data.value: The game version determines which sets of minigames are available in the game. Certain editions of the game are limited to a specific game version, while others support all of them. If an error occurs when launching the game, try changing the game version.

data.name: Games_ValidationMissingPaths
data.value: The following required paths were not found: {0}

data.name: Games_ValidationRomInvalid
data.value: The ROM is not valid for this game

data.name: Settings_StartupGameFinder
data.value: Search for installed games and game clients/emulators

data.name: Finder_NoResults
data.value: No new installed games or game clients/emulators were found

data.name: Finder_Error
data.value: An error occurred during the finder operation

data.name: Finder_FoundClients
data.value: The following new game clients/emulators were found:

data.name: Games_MissingLaunchComponent
data.value: This game can't be launched without a game client/emulator. Make sure you first add a supported game client/emulator and then select it for use with this game.

data.name: Games_RenameInfo
data.value: Rename {0}. Keep the name empty to use the default one.

data.name: Progression_SharedBackupsInfo
data.value: This game shares the same backups as the following games. This means creating a backup from one of these games will overwrite any backups created for the other ones as well.

data.name: AddGames_AddError
data.value: An error occurred when adding the game

data.name: GameClients_InvalidLocation
data.value: The selected location is not valid

data.name: GameClients_FindSuccessResult
data.value: The game client/emulator was found at {0}

data.name: GameClients_FindFailedResult
data.value: The game client/emulator was not found

data.name: GameClients_RenameHeaderInfo
data.value: Rename {0}. Keep the name empty to use the default one.

data.name: R1U_TPLSUsageInfo
data.value: Enable or disable this utility by selecting or deselecting the per-level soundtrack game client for this game

data.name: TheDarkMagiciansReignofTerror_Win32_Title
data.value: Rayman: The Dark Magician's Reign of Terror

data.name: Game_TheDarkMagiciansReignofTerror_Title
data.value: Rayman: The Dark Magician's Reign of Terror

data.name: GameSelection_FindGameFilesInfo
data.value: Find game ROMs and discs from folder

data.name: GameFileFinder_BrowseDirectoryHeader
data.value: Select folder to search for game ROMs and discs in

data.name: GameFileFinder_Error
data.value: An error occurred during the game file finder operation

data.name: GameFileFinder_GamesFound
data.value: The following new games were found:

data.name: GameFileFinder_NoResults
data.value: No new game ROMs or discs were found

data.name: GameSelection_RefreshError
data.value: An error occurred when loading the games

data.name: Settings_LoadAppNews
data.value: Load app news in the home page

data.name: AnniversaryUpdate_GamesDescription
data.value: The games page has been redesigned to support new features such as allowing for multiple installations of the same game and emulated console games. Each game now has a hub area to the right side where you can see common actions such as from the Patcher and Archive Explorer panels.

data.name: AnniversaryUpdate_ClientsDescription
data.value: New to this update is support for game clients/emulators. These can be added in a separate dialog and set to be used on added games. Game clients such as Steam are optional while console games require an emulator in order to be played. If an emulator is not in the supported list you can add it as a custom emulator. Be aware that doing so does not allow for any game progression to be shown.

data.name: AnniversaryUpdate_TextureSyncDescription
data.value: The texture sync utility has been replaced by a button in the Archive Explorer game panel for easier access. Like before you can also enable textures to automatically sync when an archive has been repacked.

data.name: R1U_TPLS_UpdateAvailable
data.value: There is a newer version available. Uninstall the current version to install it.

data.name: Archive_RepackLocked
data.value:
The archive file is currently in use by the following programs and can not be repacked. Try to close the programs and try again.
{0}

data.name: ModLoader_InstalledInfo
data.value: Mods can be installed to modify certain parts of the game. Most mods work by replacing certain game files. The mod won't go into effect until it's enabled and the changes applied, thus allowing mods to be easily toggled on and off. It is not recommended to manually change the game files which a mod modifies as it might result in some changes being lost.

data.name: ModLoader_ModifiedFilesEmpty
data.value: Install a mod to modify the game files

data.name: ModLoader_ModifiedFilesHasInvalidLocation
data.value: This file will be ignored when applying the mods due to the containing archive file not being found for this game

data.name: ModLoader_GameBanana_DownloadableModsInfo
data.value: These mods have been uploaded to GameBanana by various users

data.name: ModLoader_MigratingPatchesError
data.value: An error occurred when migrating patches to mods

data.name: ModLoader_ReadingModVersionError
data.value: The selected mod was made with a newer version of the Rayman Control Panel and can not be read

data.name: ModLoader_ReadingModError
data.value: The selected mod could not be read

data.name: ModLoader_ReadingModsError
data.value: An error occurred when loading the mods

data.name: ModLoader_SecurityWarning
data.value: The mod {0} modifies sensitive files, such as executable files, in the game. Only install this mod if you trust the author. Continue?

data.name: ModLoader_InstallError
data.value: An error occurred when installing the mod from {0}

data.name: ModLoader_InstallInvalidTargetError
data.value:
The mod {0} can't be installed to this game due to it not being one of the game targets:
{1}

data.name: ModLoader_SelectInstallTargetTitle
data.value: Select game to install the mod to

data.name: ModLoader_WriteAccessDenied
data.value: Write access is not allowed to the game installation. Try restarting as administrator. If this game is downloaded from the Microsoft Store then write access can't be achieved without first installing the game as a package through developer mode.

data.name: ModLoader_ReadLibraryVersionError
data.value: The game mod library was made with a newer version of the Rayman Control Panel and can not be read

data.name: ModLoader_ReadLibraryError
data.value: An error occurred when reading the mod library

data.name: ModLoader_DownloadModError
data.value: An error occurred when downloading and installing the mod

data.name: ModLoader_ApplyUnsuccess
data.value: Finished applying mods. Some files could not be modified.

data.name: ModLoader_ApplyError
data.value: An error occurred when applying the mods. Not all changes were applied and some data might have been lost. Make sure to not have any files from the game open while applying mods.

data.name: ModLoader_UnsupportedModulesInfo
data.value: The following modules used by this mod are unsupported and will be not be applied: {0}

data.name: ModLoader_ExtractingModError
data.value: An error occurred when extracting the mod contents

data.name: ModLoader_ExtractingModSuccess
data.value: The mod contents were successfully extracted

data.name: ModLoader_UpdateError
data.value: An error occurred when updating the mod

data.name: ModLoader_UpdateState_UnableToCheckLocal
data.value: Unable to check for updates for locally installed mods

data.name: ModCreator_ConvertLegacyPatchInfo
data.value: Starting with version 14.0 patches have been replaced by mods. You can still use patches (.gp files), but won't be able to create new ones or edit existing ones. Here you can convert a patch into a mod so it can continue to be updated.

data.name: ModCreator_Step1Info
data.value: Modules determine how the mod will modify the game. Will it simply replace files or perform more game-specific patches? The available modules differs from game to game. You can use multiple modules within the same mod.

data.name: ModCreator_Step2Info
data.value: Select a new folder to create the mod in.

data.name: ModCreator_Step3
data.value: 3. Edit the metadata, add a custom thumbnail and add module contents

data.name: ModCreator_Step3Info
data.value: It is recommended using a text editor with JSON support to edit the metadata, such as VS Code or Notepad++. Adding a thumbnail is done by adding a file named thumbnail.png with a recommended size of 128x128.

data.name: ModCreator_Step4Info
data.value: The mod is published by packing the mod folder in a supported archive format (.zip, .7z, .rar). If the mod is published to GameBanana it will show up as a downloadable mod in the mod loader. See the documentation for more details.

data.name: ModCreator_ConvertLegacyPatchError
data.value: An error occurred when converting the patches

data.name: ModCreator_CreateModNoModulesError
data.value: At least one module has to be selected in order to create a mod

data.name: ModLoader_FilesModule_Description
data.value: This is used to add, replace and remove files in the game. Useful for mods such as texture replacements that wish to replace entire files.

data.name: ModLoader_DeltasModule_DescriptionSingle
data.value: This is used to patch parts of the game file. The file name for single-file games should be 'game.delta'. Deltas from multiple mods can be stacked.

data.name: ModLoader_DeltasModule_DescriptionMulti
data.value: This is used to patch parts of a file. This should mainly be used for binary files which are known not to change much, such as an exe or game rom. Deltas from multiple mods can be stacked.

data.name: ModLoader_DeltasModule_CreateFileInfo
data.value: Create a .delta patch file from two files

data.name: ModLoader_UbiArtLocalizationModule_Description
data.value: This is used to replace or add strings in the game localization for any of the supported languages. The benefit of using this module over replacing the entire file is that multiple localization mods can be stacked.

data.name: ModLoader_GameBanana_UpdateState_MissingVersion
data.value: Unable to check for updates due to there not being a version to compare against

data.name: ModLoader_GameBanana_UpdateState_MissingFiles
data.value: Unable to check for updates due to the GameBanana mod not having any valid files

data.name: ModLoader_GameBanana_UpdateState_InvalidVersion
data.value: Unable to check for updates due to the version not being formatted correctly

data.name: ModLoader_UpdateState_UpToDate
data.value: The mod is up to date

data.name: Games_VerifyRemoveWithMods
data.value: This game has {0} applied mods. Removing the game from the program won't remove the applied mods. You can add the game back at any time to change which mods are applied. Continue?

data.name: Settings_Files_Info
data.value: Here you can specify which program to use for editing certain file types. This is used in places such as the Archive Explorer or the Progression page where you're able to use an external program to edit a file. An empty file extension is used to specify the program to use for editing binary files. It is recommended to use a hex editor for this.

data.name: Settings_Files_ConflictError
data.value: The specified file extension has already been defined

data.name: Settings_Files_FormatError
data.value: The specified file extension is not valid. It must start with a period and not have any more periods afterwards.

data.name: Settings_General_JumpListImageCaption
data.value: Launch games directly from the taskbar

data.name: Settings_WindowsIntegration_FileAssociationsInfo
data.value: This specifies which types of files will be opened in Rayman Control Panel from File Explorer

data.name: Settings_WindowsIntegration_UriAssociationsInfo
data.value: This specifies which URI protocols will be opened in Rayman Control Panel

data.name: Settings_WindowsIntegration_UpdateFileAssociationsError
data.value: An error occurred when setting the file type association. Try running the Rayman Control Panel as admin and try again.

data.name: Settings_WindowsIntegration_UpdateUriAssociationsError
data.value: An error occurred when setting the URI protocol association. Try running the Rayman Control Panel as admin and try again.

data.name: AnniversaryUpdate_ModLoaderHeader
data.value: New mod loader replaces the patcher

data.name: AnniversaryUpdate_ModLoaderDescription
data.value: The patcher has been replaced by an all new mod loader! New types of mods can now be created, such as ones which only modify parts of a file. Mods uploaded to GameBanana can now also be downloaded directly through the app. If there's a utility or other type of patch missing then it has most likely been moved over into a mod.
